docs.snippet: LEAD:  CYCLING  LeMond Regains Lead: Greg LeMond of the United States recaptured the leader's yellow jersey in the Tour de France yesterday with a strong performance in an individual time trial in the Alps. LeMond finished fifth in the day's stage,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: CYCLING LeMond Regains Lead: Greg LeMond of the United States recaptured the leader's yellow jersey in the Tour de France yesterday with a strong performance in an individual time trial in the Alps. LeMond finished fifth in the day's stage, 57 seconds behind Steven Rooks of the Netherlands, who climbed the 24 miles from Gap to Orcieres

docs.snippet: LEAD: Compared with subsidies, tariffs are a piece of cake. Everyone in international trade agrees that tariffs exist to protect industries, and because the protection is all aboveboard, postwar trade negotiators have rather easily succeeded in...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Compared with subsidies, tariffs are a piece of cake. Everyone in international trade agrees that tariffs exist to protect industries, and because the protection is all aboveboard, postwar trade negotiators have rather easily succeeded in cutting tariff rates to a fraction of their levels in the 1930's.

byline.original: By Clyde H. Farnsworth, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD:  Skiing  Bittner Captures Slalom: Armin Bittner of West Germany clocked the fastest time in the first run and held on for the victory yesterday in a World Cup slalom race at the Australian resort of Thredbo. Bittner, 24 years old, the defending...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Skiing Bittner Captures Slalom: Armin Bittner of West Germany clocked the fastest time in the first run and held on for the victory yesterday in a World Cup slalom race at the Australian resort of Thredbo. Bittner, 24 years old, the defending World Cup slalom champion, clocked 1 minute 2.52 seconds in the first run over a 74-gate course with a 205-foot vertical drop, and 59.41 seconds in the second, with 72 gates.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Facsimile machines and computers have so rapidly expanded the volume of electronic money transfers among banks throughout the world that they are effectively hiding vast sums of illegal drug profits being clandestinely sent out of the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Facsimile machines and computers have so rapidly expanded the volume of electronic money transfers among banks throughout the world that they are effectively hiding vast sums of illegal drug profits being clandestinely sent out of the United States.

headline.main: Banking's Technology Helps Drug Dealers Export Cash . . .

docs.snippet: LEAD:  AUTO RACING  Wallace First at Watkins Glen: Rusty Wallace came from far off the pace twice and drove away to an easy victory yesterday in the Budweiser at the Glen Nascar race in Watkins Glen, N.Y. The hard-charging Wallace, who finished...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AUTO RACING Wallace First at Watkins Glen: Rusty Wallace came from far off the pace twice and drove away to an easy victory yesterday in the Budweiser at the Glen Nascar race in Watkins Glen, N.Y. The hard-charging Wallace, who finished second to Ricky Rudd last year after winning in 1987, survived being caught in the wrong place on a caution flag and a flat tire under the green flag to win for the fourth time this season.

docs.snippet: LEAD: THE Government's chief expert on dengue fever has warned that the public must take a more active role in eradicating mosquitos to curb the spread of the infection.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE Government's chief expert on dengue fever has warned that the public must take a more active role in eradicating mosquitos to curb the spread of the infection.

headline.main: In Battling Dengue Fever Mosquitos, Expert Enlists Public's Assistance

docs.snippet: LEAD: If tough early-round opponents can sharpen a tennis star's game, Ivan Lendl should be in top form and Steffi Graf should be ripe for upset by the time the United States Open reaches its late stages in a couple of weeks.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: If tough early-round opponents can sharpen a tennis star's game, Ivan Lendl should be in top form and Steffi Graf should be ripe for upset by the time the United States Open reaches its late stages in a couple of weeks.

headline.main: Early Draws Differ For Lendl and Graf

docs.snippet: LEAD: Tulsa, a young, sophisticated city on the edge of the prairie, revels in its heritage, the Indian, the cowboy, but predominantly in oil, which propelled it from cow town to ''oil capital of the world.'' Today, that boastful sobriquet is more...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Tulsa, a young, sophisticated city on the edge of the prairie, revels in its heritage, the Indian, the cowboy, but predominantly in oil, which propelled it from cow town to ''oil capital of the world.'' Today, that boastful sobriquet is more nostalgia than fact. The oil business is both depressed and headquartered elsewhere.

byline.original: By SUSAN EVERLY-DOUZE; SUSAN EVERLY-DOUZE is a writer who lives in Tulsa
